Package org.eclipse.mosaic.lib.coupling

Class ClientServerChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.mosaic.lib.coupling.ClientServerChannel
  • public class ClientServerChannel
extends Object
    Abstraction of Ambassador->Federate Byte Protocol for coupling of a network federate to MOSAIC.

      • writeInitBody

        public int writeInitBody​(long startTime,
                         long endTime)
                  throws IOException
        Initialize scheduler with given times.
        Parameters:
        startTime - the first point in time simulated by the simulator
        endTime - the last timestep simulated by the simulator
        Returns:
        command returned by the federate
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeSendMessage

        public int writeSendMessage​(long time,
                            int srcNodeId,
                            int msgId,
                            long msgLength,
                            DestinationAddressContainer dac)
                     throws IOException
        Write send message header to stream. Not used in eWorld visualizer.
        Parameters:
        time - simulation time at which the message is sent
        srcNodeId - ID of the sending node //TODO: maybe make this an IP? -> nodes would have a bilinear mapping to IP addresses
        msgId - the ID of the message
        msgLength - length of the message
        dac - DestinationAddressContainer with the destination address of the sender and additional information
        Returns:
        command returned by the federate
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeConfigMessage

        public int writeConfigMessage​(long time,
                              int msgID,
                              int externalId,
                              AdHocConfiguration configuration)
                       throws IOException
        Takes a configuration message and inserts it via the wrapped protobuf channel Configuration is then sent to the federate.
        Parameters:
        time - the logical time at which the configuration happens
        msgID - the ID of the configuration message
        externalId - the external (federate-internal) ID of the node
        configuration - the actual configuration
        Returns:
        command returned by the federate
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeAdvanceTimeMessage

        public void writeAdvanceTimeMessage​(long time)
                             throws IOException
        Command: advance time.
        Parameters:
        time - point in time up to which advance is granted
        Throws:
        IOException

        Parameters:
        cmd - the command to write onto the channel
        Throws:
